children.name: theft b2
children.definition: theft/θeft/  trộm cắp
examples: this warehouse is not adequately protected against theft or vandalism.
the mayor is taking credit for decreases in theft since he took office.
car/luggage/bicycle etc theft
the rate of bicycle theft in this area is very high.

children.name: robbery b2
children.definition: robbery the crime of stealing money or other things from a bank, shop etc, especially by using threats or violence:ăn trộm
examples: perkins was given five years in prison for robbery with violence.
robbery was believed to be the motive for the killing.
armed robbery[when robbers carry weapons] ăn cắp có vũ trang
he made two escape attempts while serving a sentence for armed robbery.
he is in prison forarmedrobbery.
commit a robbery
the gang admitted they hadcommittedfour recent bank robberies.

children.name: burglary b1
children.definition: burglary the crime of illegally entering a house, office etc and stealing things:' nạn trộm cắp
examples: foster had been in prison twice already for burglary.
burglary, murder and rape are all on the increase'.
if you live in an area where burglary is common, it may be worth investing in an alarm system.

children.name: shoplifting x
children.definition: shoplifting the crime of taking things from shops without paying for them: trộm cắp trong cửa hàng/siêu thị
examples: shoplifting cost the major stores millions of dollars last year.
he was charged with shoplifting.

children.name: embezzlement x
children.definition: embezzlement the crime of stealing money from the place where you work, especially over a long period of time: ăn cắp tiền từ nơi làm việc
examples: taylor left the country to escape charges of embezzlement.
embezzlement of
the judge sentenced walker to five years in prison for embezzlement of state funds.

children.name: joyriding x
children.definition: joyriding the crime of stealing a car and driving it very fast for fun: ăn cắp xe
examples: anyone found guilty of joyriding can now be sentenced for up to five years in prison.

children.name: larceny x
children.definition: larceny/ˈlɑːʳsəni/   the crime of stealing -used especially in the american legal system: cướp phá
examples: brook now faces probable jail after an indictment for larceny and income tax evasion.

children.name: to steal from a buiding or place
rob b1
children.definition: rob to steal money or property from a bank, shop etc, especially by using threats or violence: cướp, đánh cướp (một nơi nào)
examples: he got five years in jail for robbing a gas station.
two men robbed the central bank yesterday, escaping with over $1 million.

children.name: burgle b2
children.definition: burgle/ burglarize  to illegally enter a house or office and steal things:
examples: đột nhập vào nhà để ăn trộm
he was caught burgling the house of a police officer.
our apartment has been burglarized twice since we moved here.

children.name: shoplift x
children.definition: shoplift to steal things from a shop, for example by hiding them under your clothes or in a bag: ăn cắp cái gì trong cửa hàng/siêu thị
examples: the clerk spotted the girl shoplifting and stopped her from leaving the store.

children.name: hold up x
children.definition: hold up to go into a bank, shop etc with a gun and demand money:
examples: đột nhập vào ngân hàng, cửa hàng để ăn cắp tiền
hold up sth
the men who held up the store were wearing halloween masks.
hold sth up
they held the same bank up twice in one week.

children.name: loot x
children.definition: loot/luːt/  to steal things from shops or other buildings, especially during a war or at a time when the police or army have lost control of an area: ăn cắp đồ
examples: his store was broken into and looted during the riot.
as the army advanced toward mantes it burned and looted everything that lay in its path.
looting[u noun]ăn cắp đồ
additional police officers were put on the street to prevent looting.
looter[c noun]kẻ ăn cắp đồ
in full view of our cameras, looters calmly walked off with tvs, radios, and vcrs.

children.name: burglary b1
children.definition: burglary when sb enters a house or other building illegally and steals things: vụ trộm cắp
examples: call the police -- there’s been a burglary.
most burglaries occur when a house or apartment is empty.

children.name: mugging x
children.definition: mugging an attack on someone in a public place such as a street, in order to steal something from them: vụ cướp dật, trấn lột
examples: preston was a victim of a mugging three months ago.
there have been a number of muggings outside downtown hotels recently.
police are concerned that mugging is on the increase.
a spate/series of muggings[several muggings in a short period of time] một loạt các vụ cướp dật
police are investigating a spate of muggings that took place on the campus last week.

children.name: robbery b2
children.definition: robbery/ˈrɒbəriǁˈrɑː-/  when someone steals money or other things from a bank, shop etc, especially by using threats or violence: vụ ăn cướp
examples: ▪ i took part in my first robbery when i was only thirteen years old.
▪ in the first nine months of this year there were 9611 street robberies involving violence
robbery of: ăn cướp từ
▪ police claim to have found the gun used in this morning’s robbery of a downtown convenience store.
bank robbery: cướp ngân hàng
▪ the police are investigating a series of bank robberies.

children.name: break-in x
children.definition: break-in when sb breaks a door or window in order to enter a place and steal things: vụ đột nhập
examples: there was a break-in at the college last night -- they took all the computers.

children.name: hold-up x
children.definition: hold-up/ stick-up  when sb goes into a bank or shop with a gun and demands money: vụ đột nhập vào ngân hàng hay của hàng bằng bạo lực để đòi tiền
examples: a man was shot dead in a hold-up at a downtown bank.

children.name: theft b2
children.definition: theft/θeft/   when something is stolen: vụ ăn cướp
examples: if your passport has been stolen, report the theft to your nearest embassy immediately.
theft of
security has been tightened since the theft of a $150,000 oil painting.
car/bicycle etc thefts:những vụ ăn cướp xe/xe đạp
police believe they have found the man responsible for a series of car thefts in the past year.

children.name: raid x
children.definition: raid/reɪd/  when sb goes into a bank or shop while it is open, and steals money or other things using threats or violence: ăn cắp từ ngân hàng hay cửa hàng bằng cách đe dọa hoặc dùng bạo lực
examples: the police accused the woman of planning a huge armed bank raid in scotland.
millions of dollars were stolen in abankraid last night.
raid on
detectives managed to catch the gunman who had taken three hostages in a raid on a jeweller’s shop.
carry out a raid:tiến hành vụ cắp
police have released a photo of a man they believe carried out a raid on a supermarket.

children.name: job x
children.definition: job  a crime that involves stealing: vụ án
examples: her boyfriend was put in prison after a bank job theft from a bank.
he was put in prison for five years fordoingabankjob.
inside job[done by someone within the organization]vụ án có tổ chức
the police are convinced it was an inside job.

children.name: stolen u
children.definition: stolen bị ăn cắp
examples: thieves can sell stolen passports for a lot of money.
the antiques he was selling turned out to be stolen.
stolen goods:đồ dùng bị ăn cắp
wilson was convicted of theft and handling stolen goods.

children.name: loot x
children.definition: loot informal the things that have been stolen during a particular robbery: đồ bị ăn cắp
examples: the gunman stuffed the loot into a paper bag and ran outside to a waiting car.
two weeks later, police found the loot hidden in an abandoned warehouse.

children.name: haul c2
children.definition: haul/hɔːl/  a large amount of things that have been stolen: một mẻ thứ đồ bị cắp
examples: trevino hid the haul in his mother’s closet for over a year.
the police caught three men examining their haul in a house in north london.
a drugs haul
a haul of arms/ drugs

children.name: steal a2
children.definition: steal/stiːl/  to take something that does not belong to you without the owner’s permission in a dishonest or illegal way:ăn cắp
examples: ▪ thousands of cars get stolen every year
▪ in the end he had to steal in order to survive.
steal from
▪ drug addicts who steal from their friends and families
steal sth from
▪ thieves stole paintings worth $5 million from a paris art gallery.
have sth stolen
▪ it’s strange he should have had so many things stolen in just a week.
get stolen: bị ăn cắp
my grandfather refused to put his money in a bank because he was afraid it would get stolen.
stealing[u noun]ăn cắp
many people don’t regard cheating on their taxes as stealing.

children.name: take b1
children.definition: take/teɪk/  to steal something, especially money or things that can be carried away:
examples: lấy, cuỗm
someone has been taking money from the cash box.
the burglars took our tv and stereo, but they didn’t find the jewellery.

children.name: nick/pinch x
children.definition: nick/pinch/nɪk, pɪntʃ/    to steal something: ăn cắp cái gì
examples: ▪ i wonder where she got that coat -- do you think she nicked it?
▪ jimmy was caught pinching money from his mum’s purse.

children.name: rip off x
children.definition: rip off spoken to steal sth, especially someone’s personal possessions: ăn cắp cái gì (đặc biệt là tài sản cá nhân)
examples: rip off sth
while i was out, someone went into my hotel room and ripped off the rest of my travelers’ checks.
rip off sth
he rips stuff off from supermarkets to pay for his heroin.

children.name: go off with x
children.definition: go off with/ walk off with /ˌgəʊ ˈɒf wɪð, ˌwɔːk ˈɒf wɪð/   to steal something veryeasily, by picking it up and walking away with it, usually without anyone noticing: dễ dàng ăn cắp cái gì
examples: my bag’s disappeared! that woman must have walked off with it!
guards in the lobby prevent employees from going off with computers and sensitive documents.

children.name: help yourself to u
children.definition: help yourself to/ˌhelp jɔːʳˈself tuː/  informal to steal something very easily without anyone trying to stop you: ăn cắp cái gì một cách dễ dàng
examples: ▪ while no one was looking louise and alice helped themselves to some apples and bananas.
▪ burglars cut through the ceiling and helped themselves to $3.6 million in jewels.

children.name: pilfer x
children.definition: pilfer/ˈpɪlfəʳ/  to steal things, especially small things or things you do not think are very valuable: ăn cắp vặt
examples: ▪ the farmer caught them pilfering apples from his orchard.
▪ the villagers pilfered stones from ancient ruined cities to build their houses.
pilfering[uncountable noun]ăn cắp vặt
▪ losses from stores through shoplifting and pilfering amounted to over a billion dollars last year.
pilferverb[ i or t ]chôm chỉa;ăn cắp vặt
to steal things of small value
_he was caught pilfering (sweets)fromthe shop.

children.name: swipe x
children.definition: swipe/swaɪp/   to steal something quickly when someone is not looking:ăn cắp
examples: while i was swimming in the river, somebody swiped all my clothes!
i wish i knew who’d swiped my earrings.

children.name: snitch x
children.definition: snitch/snɪtʃ/   informal to steal something, especially something small and not very valuable:ăn cắp vặt
examples: ▪ the supermarket has a problem with kids snitching candy bars off the shelves.
▪ he watched as grover snitched two packets of sugar from behind the counter.

children.name: to steal from sb in public place
rob b1
children.definition: rob to steal money or possessions from someone, especially using threats or violence and in a public place such as a street: ăn cắp
examples: two men tried to rob him as he left the restaurant.
the woman had been robbed and was badly shaken.
they robbed the companyof£2 million.

children.name: mug x
children.definition: mug/mʌg/  to attack someone and take money from them in a public place such as a street:cướp dật ( nơi công cộng )
examples: ▪ since moving to new jersey, he has been mugged at gunpoint twice.
▪ if anyone ever tried to mug me, i would throw my bag and run.
get mugged : bị cướp dật
i was scared i would get mugged or raped.

children.name: snatch x
children.definition: snatch to steal sb’s bag from them in the street and then run away : giật (túi xách)
examples: a young boy pushed her over and snatched her purse as she fell.

children.name: to steal money that you have been trusted to look after
embezzle x
children.definition: embezzle to steal money from the place where you work, especially over a long period of time: ăn cắp (tiền ở nơi làm việc trong thời gian dài)
examples: the court was told that julie had been embezzling funds for the last two years.
he embezzled large amounts of money to finance his gambling.
she embezzled thousands of dollarsfromthe charity.

children.name: misappropriate x
children.definition: misappropriate formal to steal money that you had been trusted to keep safe: làm tiêu, phung phí
examples: during the trial, raabe admitted that he misappropriated $80,000 of church funds.

children.name: have your fingers in the till x
children.definition: have your fingers in the till   informal to steal money from the place where you work, especially when your work involves handling money: ăn cắp tiền từ nơi làm việc
examples: they knew that money was going missing and davy was eventually caught with his fingers in the till.
